Description: Small disc made of fired clay, roughly disc-shaped but with a trapezoidal section with a wider base, in the centre a perforation. On the base a circumferential incised line around the edge of the object, same at the top but here the incised line is found at the lateral face just under the edge. Roughly and irregular shaped from forming by hand, probably a spindlewhorl.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D15.P, Mound β, level 2
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
